critique: The document is an executive order by President Franklin D. Roosevelt in 1933 addressing the payment of patronage dividends by cooperative organizations, particularly farmers' cooperatives, under the National Industrial Recovery Act. It clarifies that provisions in codes of fair competition should not be interpreted to prohibit these dividends, provided they are paid out of actual earnings and not at the time of purchase. The order aims to protect the interests of cooperative organizations and their members within the framework of the New Deal's economic policies.
